listing.description: Redesigned, reimagined and refurbished to exacting and stylish standards, this is a most impressive two bedroom apartment in a very popular riverside development. No detail of design or execution has been overlooked - from the stylish bathrooms to the underfloor heating and the extremely well-appointed kitchen. Clearly conceived with serious cooking in mind, the kitchen has been the subject of a great deal of thought and design and is impressively well-equipped, including a built-in gas fired charcoal griddle. The accommodation further comprises two double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one of which is en suite and open-plan to the master bedroom) and an extensive quasi open-plan reception/kitchen room of roughly 20 ft. By 20 ft. From which the terrace and the kitchen can be accessed. Riverview Gardens is a brick built mid-20th century development surrounded by beautifully maintained communal gardens. It is very well placed to access both river walks, the shops and restaurants of Fulham Palace Road and the public transport, shops and bars et al of Hammersmith. The development boasts an award winning concierge service, a residents’ pool and secure parking. EPC rating C.

listing.description: This development offers the following schemes:Part Exchange - Our part exchange schemes enables you to buy the house of your dreams – worry-free!Home Change - We can help sell your home in three simple stepsSchemes are available on selected plots only, subject to status, terms and conditions apply. Contact the development for latest information.Plot SpecificsStyle DescriptionPrice is available subject to status, terms and conditions apply.SpecificationSpecificationWe are a national house builder with a local approach to building your new home.We will provide you with the specification appropriate to the locality of your selected new home and development and we will explain the choice of external materials used, for example your brick colour and roof tiles. You will be able to select certain elements of the fixtures and fittings encompassing the latest designs from leading manufacturers, subject to the stage of build of your chosen home. If you wish to further personalise your new home, an exciting range of options is available to purchase from our Finishing Touches scheme. Our experienced sales team is on hand to guide you through the choices available to you depending again on the stage of build.Quality AssuredYour new home will be built in accordance with all relevant technical and building regulations, in particular the Government’s Code for Sustainable Homes. In addition all stages of the construction of your new home will be inspected by our experienced construction staff. On completion of your new home we will provide you with a quality assured certificate for you to keep.10-year NHBC (or equivalent) WarrantyA 10-year warranty is provided with every new Charles Church home. A comprehensive guide explaining the warranty will be supplied to you.We will ensure warranties provided by the manufacturers of appliances are honoured for the first year of occupation. Our Customer Care Department is on hand to offer you the necessary guidance and assistance.About Great Woodcote ParkEnjoy elegant living at Great Woodcote ParkStep into a world of elegant living when you experience the superb range of four and five bedroom detached homes at Great Woodcote Park in Exeter. You'll find modern homes with thoughtful design touches and luxury living space that flows from room to room. What’s more, Great Woodcote Park is situated in one of Exeter’s most popular and sought-after locations with great amenities and superb commuter links practically on your doorstep.The houses on this stunning development have been carefully designed to make the most of their surroundings, for example some offer an interesting reverse level accommodation providing access from the kitchen and living room directly onto a roof terrace others have two en suites to cater for the larger family. External finishes have been thoughtfully designed too, with a combination of brick, render and stone featuring timber, tile and weatherboard cladding to specific elevations.Our exclusive homes await you…Additionally, Great Woodcote Park is home to an exclusive gated development which holds a unique collection of only five four and five bedroom luxury detached homes which are all available to view today. These beautiful properties are practically a blank canvas inside and offer you the chance to be part of a much more bespoke experience, as you can contribute to the interior design of the home you have always dreamed of owning.Opening HoursMonday 11am - 6pm, Tuesday Closed, Wednesday Closed, Thursday 11am - 6pm, Friday 11am - 6pm, Saturday 11am - 6pm, Sunday 11am - 6pmDisclaimerImages depict typical Charles Church house type. listing.description: A substantial and thoughtfully converted four double bedroom former farm building with a tastefully designed interior. An exceptional home set within the privacy and security of this select gated development around a mews style courtyard, within a mile of the village of Theydon Bois with its own central line tube station providing access to the City and West End.The generously proportioned rooms have a real sense of light and space with a particular feature being the vast double storey height windows which bathe the impressive hall and galleried landing in natural light. The inter-connecting ground floor living space provides a great open plan area, perfect for entertaining.Exposed timbers, vaulted ceilings, traditional panel radiators, underfloor heating on the ground level, modern design bathrooms and a bespoke fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and granite worktops all add to the character, yet contemporary feel of the property.The accommodation briefly comprises an Entrance Hall leading to the inner hall and galleried landing, a substantial lounge, large kitchen with open aspect to the Dining / Family / Sitting Room, Cloakroom, Master Bedroom with En-Suite Shower Room, three further Double Bedrooms and Family Bathroom.Externally, the property is accessed via electric security gates along a gravel drive to the courtyard area which provides access to a large multi bay in / out garage providing two allocated parking spaces with a further two designated outbuildings for personal storage.   In addition to its own mature private garden, extending to around 80' with patio and lawn, you have the benefit of further communal grounds and, taking centre stage, a delightful pond, a pleasant spot to sit, relax and unwind. The perfect antidote to a busy working life.

listing.description: This beautiful detached home sits delightfully at the centre of this attractive village on the southerly slopes on the North Downs close to the famous Pilgrims Way. Nearby amenities include a stone church, village pubs and shops plus a primary school and mainline station. Journey times to the capital via rail take a little over an hour.The property itself was constructed in a decorative style influenced by the Arts & Craft movement. Currently the home is configured with four generous bedrooms served by an en-suite and family bathroom. The 3 reception rooms are complemented by the very modern kitchen and adjoining breakfast room that is overlooked by a first floor 'mezzanine' study.Externally there are well tended gardens to both front and rear plus side gardens and a rear passage. listing.description: Entrance hall 14' 4" x 14' 2" (4.38m x 4.32m) maxliving room 23' 8" x 14' 4" (7.23m x 4.37m) maxkitchen/dining/family room 36' 10" x 29' 4" (11.25m x 8.95m) maxutility room 12' 3" x 6' 8" (3.75m x 2.04m)wet room 6' 7" x 5' 5" (2.02m x 1.67m)WC first floor landing bedroom 1 20' 9" x 19' 2" (6.35m x 5.85m) maxensuite bedroom 2  15' 0" x 14' 10" (4.59m x 4.53m) maxbedroom 3  15' 5" x 14' 11" (4.72m x 4.57m) maxbedroom 4 11' 6" x 10' 7" (3.53m x 3.23m)bathroom 9' 10" x 9' 6" (3.02m x 2.92m)  Ivan House is a brand new, four double bedroomed detached property set in an enviable, rural location on the outskirts of the highly regarded village of Henham. The village of Henham provides good amenities including the village jmi School which has an excellent reputation. There is also a public house, active local church and community groups. Stansted Airport with fast train services and the M11 (J8) is approximately 10 minutes by car. The market town of Bishops Stortford is 9 miles to the south  The open plan kitchen offers flexible living accommodation with the modern conveniences of a range cooker with 6 ring gas hob, wine cooler, American style fridge/freezer, built in microwave, dishwasher and double butler sink. This is further enhanced by Quartz work surfaces and soft close drawers and doors. listing.description: Summary  Occupying a prime location in this busy Cotswolds town, a freehold retail/residential investment offering tremendous development potential.The ground floor retail unit extends to approximately 1400 sq ft and comprises of a large shop with extensive storage providing an opportunity to extend the existing retail space if required.To the first and second floor is a good quality duplex apartment comprising; living room, dining room/bedroom three, study area, bedroom, bathroom & shower room and a kitchen/breakfast room.To the second floor is a further bedroom and dressing room.Outside the apartment enjoys lovely private gardens and benefits from off road parking accessed via an electric gate off Church Lane.Location  Burford is traditionally known as the 'Gateway to the Cotswolds' An area of outstanding natural beauty protected by the Cotswold Conservation Board. Burford itself has a broad main high street lined with old houses cottages and shops which appear not to have changed for hundreds of years. The town is situated just off the A40,19 miles from Oxford, 29 miles from Gloucester and 75 miles from London.The town offers good facilities including a comprehensive school, primary school, medical surgery, library, numerous public houses and a variety of shops.Planning  Planning was granted on the 7th June 2012 (12/0890/P/fp)"Erection of dwelling and detached carport with studio/storage above, internal alterations to flat and storage area to shop"

Right at the heart of one of London’s most desirable residential districts, and moments from the city’s vibrant West End. Kitchens All kitchen units will be supplied and fitted by bespoke kitchen specialist joiners Molteni or Asselle. Key features will include: • Dark timber veneer panels • Marble/quartz worktops • 18mm sturdy carcasses • High quality cabinet hardware • Soft closers throughout • Handleless doors • Mirror splashbacks • All fitted appliances shall be Miele or similar high quality. Appliances will include: • Fridge/freezer • Multi-function single oven with grill • Microwave or combination oven • Concealed dishwasher • Electric induction hob • Utility rooms to be fitted with high quality cupboards, washer/driers to be Miele or similar. Bedrooms Bedrooms to be provided with walk-in wardrobes in luxurious dark timber veneer or single wardrobes with contrasting timber veneer finish. listing.description: Coastal LivingGuide £1,000,000 to £1,100,000 -A truly superb four bedroom semi-detached family home, beautifully presented and appointed throughout and having been skillfully enlarged to make a comfortable family home. Situated in a sought after residential location off New Church Road and the Lagoon District of Hove this property is offered for sale in superb decorative order and successfully combines original character with the comforts of modern living.This quality family home, is both tasteful and on trend, the whole of which is offered in pristine condition. The spacious entrance hall, with reclaimed parquet flooring leads to a large and open plan L shaped kitchen/ reception and games area . In short, the social hub of the house. This well "zoned" use of space truly creates a wonderful area for all the family to enjoy. The superb bespoke kitchen, with granite worktops and coastal feature splash -back has been designed to exacting standards with the advantage of high tech appliances and plenty of storage, Bi folding doors lead out onto a raised decked area and the lawned garden is positioned to take advantage of the sun, with options for "al-fresco" dining too! The ground floor also benefits from an additional large west facing reception room with a wonderful open fire place with marble surround. There is also a separate study or guest bedroom on this level with a handy utility and wet room. As you ascend to the first floor the stylish, contemporary theme, with stairway Roger Oates runners continues There are 4 good sized double bedrooms on the first floor, serviced by a superbly fitted family bathroom and the generous master, with en-suite boasts partial sea views. There is scope to enlarge the remainder of the house with a loft conversion and roof terrace ( subject to the necessary consents) and planning permission is in place to extend one of the bedrooms. Wish Road passes between New Church Road and Hove seafront and the delightful Wish Park.

listing.description: Boughton House is a purpose-built development of just 9 apartments, situated approximately 15 minutes walk from Henley town centre and the railway station. The property was built in 2006 by Court Park Properties. No 9 Boughton House is the penthouse apartment, occupying the whole of the second floor and benefiting from over 2500 sq. Ft of accommodation.AccommodationCommunal front door with video entry system. Staircase leads to second floor with part-glazed door leading into the entrance hall with a storage cupboard.The reception hall has a ceramic tile floor, recessed spotlights and a deep cloaks cupboard housing the megaflo hot water tank.Double doors lead into the spectacular sitting room, which has a dual aspect with rooftop views. To one wall there is extensive illuminated book shelving. In addition to the dormer windows there are skylight windows allowing further natural light.The large kitchen/breakfast room has an extensive range of fitted wall and base units with granite work surfaces over. Fitted appliances include a single oven, microwave and dishwasher. The central island unit has an extensive counter top with overhang to allow for breakfast bar seating, power points and bookshelves under. There are ceramic tiles, recessed spotlights and a skylight window. To one end of the kitchen there is a very useful walk-in pantry with matching ceramic tiles. In addition, there is a utility cupboard with plumbing for the washing machine and extensive eaves storage.The master bedroom has a dual aspect with low level eaves storage. The en suite dressing room has two banks of wardrobes with sliding doors and a step up to the well-appointed shower room, comprising a white suite with large double shower tray, his and hers sink units and a WC. There is a heated towel rail, a skylight window and ceramic tiled floor.Bedroom two has a fitted wardrobe and skylight windows.The spacious family bathroom has a white suite comprising a panelled bath, a double shower cubicle, a WC with a concealed cistern and a wash hand basin. There is a heated towel rail, tiled walls and floor, and recessed spotlights.Bedroom three has a timber floor, fitted book shelving and recessed spotlights.Bedroom 4/study has a timber floor, built-in wardrobes and recessed spotlights.OutsideBoughton house sits within grounds of approximately half an acre with ample car parking for residents and visitors. The well-maintained gardens have areas of lawn, mature shrubs and raised beds with mature trees, providing a degree of privacy.Living in Green LaneGreen Lane is situated approximately 0.5 miles to the west of Henley town centre and Henley railway station. It is ideally located within walking distance of local amenities and popular schools for all ages. There is a regular bus service to Henley town centre, with bus stops on Greys Road.The 'Top Shops' are just a short walk away. They offer a 'One Stop' convenience store, a nail salon, launderette and a hairdresser, a 'Happy Wok' Chinese takeaway, and a fish bar with pizza delivery.Henley town centre has a wide selection of shops, including a Waitrose supermarket. There are boutiques, a cinema, a theatre, excellent pubs and restaurants, a bustling market every Thursday and good schools for all ages. The commuter is well provided for with the M4 and M40 motorways giving access to London, Heathrow, West Country and Midlands. Henley Station has direct links with London Paddington 55 minutes (Crossrail via Twyford in 2018).Reading - 7 milesMaidenhead M4 Junction 8/9 - 11 milesLondon Heathrow - 25 milesLondon West End - 36 milesSchoolsPrimary Schools - Trinity Primary (Ofsted - Outstanding), Sacred Heart Primary (Ofsted - Good), Valley Road (Ofsted - Good)Secondary Schools - Gillotts School (Ofsted - Good)Sixth Form - Henley CollegePrivate- St Mary's School, Rupert House SchoolBuses operate to the larger private schools in Shiplake, Reading and Abingdon.LeisureRiver pursuits include rowing and kayaking. The world famous Henley Royal Regatta takes place in July followed by the Henley Festival of Arts, and the Rewind Festival in August. Marina facilities at Harleyford and Wargrave, river moorings in Henley. Golf at Henley Golf Club and Badgemore Park Golf Club. Other sports clubs include rugby, hockey, football and lawn tennis. There is superb walking, cycling and riding in the Chiltern Hills, a designated area of outstanding natural beauty. Phyllis Court Country Club is situated on the river, and is a great place to socialise.Tenure - FreeholdLocal Authority - South Oxfordshire District Council, Council Tax Band - FViewing - Strictly by appointment via Philip Booth Esq or

listing.description: A delightful family home, this property has a south sea-facing aspect and is named after the 200-year-old mature oak tree, a feature of the beautifully designed rear garden. Built in the 1980s, the property has individual charm and character; there are fireplaces in the two main reception rooms and beams in the kitchen/breakfast room. The elegant lines of this well-maintained and sympathetically improved property are quite unique, providing a substantial home of some 3,400 square feet.In addition, the first-floor balcony is 300 square feet and extends the full width of the house, with direct access from the master bedroom and the first-floor sitting room. The hall includes a charming arch that currently houses a piano. There are stairs to the first floor, of course, and the hall provides separate direct access to most downstairs rooms: The large reception/dining room, kitchen/breakfast room, a utility area and separate downstairs wet room (with shower, toilet and handbasin), and a quiet corner room that works well as a double bedroom or large study. Given its proximity to the adjacent wet room it could be useful as a guest suite or for elderly friends and relatives who find the stairs difficult.An internal brick arch creates open-plan access between the reception/ dining room and the contemporary kitchen/breakfast room, which has a double oven, hob, built-in cupboards and a full range of appliances. Double glass doors from sitting/dining room provide the entrance to a separate spacious games room/library, which has a through aspect and opens directly onto the ground-floor terrace to the front and to the rear garden patio. The ground floor provides excellent space for entertaining or just to relax with family and friends.On the first floor, a large light and airy sitting room and the master bedroom both have wide, sliding doors to the balcony with views across the cliff and the Hythe Imperial Golf Course, to the English Channel beyond which dominates the landscape. On summer evenings and clear days, the French coastline can be seen in the distance to the southeast.There are two additional first-floor double bedrooms and a family bathroom.What the Owner says:Considered the most desirable residential location in the area, Cliff Road is made up of unique, individual homes of different styles and sizes. This property has been in the present owner’s family since 2003. During that time the plot has been re-landscaped and the property updated and modernised. It benefits from a peaceful location, only a few minutes to the sea front and Hythe’s historic town centre. The High Street has a village feel, with an array of individual shops, hairdressers, cafés and restaurants (Waitrose and Sainsbury’s are also close by).On the coast, the Hythe Imperial Hotel has a 9-hole golf course, gym and spa, while the historic Military Canal offers lovely walks along the towpath.More enthusiastic golfers can enjoy 18 holes at Sene Valley, the golf course designed by Henry Cotton that this property backs on to.For rail travellers, the excellent high-speed service from Folkestone West is just 52 minutes to London St. Pancras (36 minutes from Ashford International). Nearby Sandling Station provides a good local rail service, and then on to Waterloo East and Charing Cross. There are also regular local bus services at the end of Cliff Road, and dependable taxis, usually within 15 minutes.Room sizes:Split level ground floorEntrance HallSitting/Dining Area 21'2 x 14'3 (6.46m x 4.35m)Games Room/Library 24'0 x 16'0 (7.32m x 4.88m)Kitchen/Breakfast Area 19'5 x 11'1 (5.92m x 3.38m)Utility 6'6 x 5'3 (1.98m x 1.60m)Shower RoomBedroom 5 13'0 x 11'1 (3.97m x 3.38m)First floorLandingMaster Bedroom 17'11 x 16'2 (5.46m x 4.93m)Bedroom 3 13'1 x 11'2 (3.99m x 3.41m)BathroomBedroom 2 15'0 x 10'11 (4.58m x 3.33m)Sitting Room 21'3 x 14'5 (6.48m x 4.40m)En-suiteOutsideGarage 17'9 x 16'5 (5.41m x 5.01m)South Facing balconyTerraceSecond floorStudy/Bedroom 4 30'7 x 14'3 (9.33m x 4.35m)The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: With two already sold and just two garden units remaining, this highly desirable three bedroom apartment provides wonderfully stylish and elegant interiors, boasting an 80’ garden and allocated off-street parking.The heart of the property is a fabulously generous open-plan living and entertaining space with raised kitchen zone, perfectly complimented by high ceilings with skylights and beautiful engineered oak and polished concrete flooring which links seamlessly via floor-to-ceiling doors out to the patio and large south-facing turfed garden beyond. Cooking and food preparation are taken care of by an exquisitely finished German designer kitchen with white quartz work-tops, large breakfast bar and quality Siemens appliances. The accommodation is completed by a luxurious family bathroom and three well-proportioned double bedrooms. The master bedroom featuring an attractive curved bay window and smart ensuite shower room. In the hallway there is a dedicated laundry facility housing a Siemans washing machine and separate tumble dryer. A full under-floor heating system provides the last word in comfort.Beautifully converted from two 1930’s houses with a striking period façade this stunning new luxury development features an exclusive selection of architect-designed apartments superbly located within just a few minutes’ walk of popular local schools, shopping on Church Street and leafy Clissold Park. Transport links are excellent with rail links to The West End (Piccadilly line) and The City (fifteen minutes to Liverpool Street).High performance acoustic and thermal insulation form part of this environmentally friendly construction and all apartments benefit from 10 year blp housing warranty insurance.

listing.description: A totally unique opportunity to purchase a substantial site extending to around three acres in total with two individual substantial detached properties, one benefitting from a two bedroomed annexe and a substantial barn/storage and office complex and including a paddock. The property would ideally be suited to continued business use from the barn, however one of the properties is currently successfully let on a holiday basis and should the new owners choose this could also a successful option for the second property and could allow further development opportunity of the barn (subject to the necessary planning permissions). A viewing is essential to appreciate the uniqueness of this site and the high quality finish off both properties throughout & the fantastic rural position.Kyme Barn Is a superb individual detached barn conversion with its own detached self contained two bedroomed annexe, the property has been converted to give large spacious rooms throughout. The accommodation spread over two floors comprises; living/family kitchen, utility room, ground floor shower room, family room, living room, master bedroom with en-suite. To the first floor are three further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The annexe which is detached benefits from a central living/dining area, at either end of the property is a spacious double bedroom with its own en-suite shower room. The property has a spacious flagstone courtyard, gardens with affording views over open farm land, an open fronted double garage and a workshop/barn currently used as workshop/storage and offices extending to in the region of 3,000 square feet with accommodation comprises; full height workshop, three store rooms/workshops. To the first floor is a large open plan well lit office, a second boardroom and attic storage. Outside is a substantial concrete hard standing area ideal for parking numerous vehicles, plant and equipment. There is also a secure electrically operated ballard entrance. Having windows and two sets of carthouse style french doors giving access to courtyard, a vaulted beam ceiling and flagstone effect flooring. The kitchen area is fitted with a range of shaker style base units with a composite worktop over, range cooker in recessed chimney breast setting, under mounted sink and TV point.Family Room25'3" x 13'6" (7.7m x 4.11m). Having windows and doors to both front and rear elevations giving access to garden, exposed brick chimney breast housing multi-fuelled burning stove, solid wood flooring, radiator and TV point. The rear garden is stepped with a dwarf wall and principle laid to a generously proportioned shaped lawn, hedged to side elevations with a Lincolnshire style post and rail fencing to the rear elevation and affording far reaching views over open farmland. The garden further extends to the side with additional substantial lawned area enclosed by hedging.Kyme View Hardwood door leads to:Entrance Hallway10'9" x 4'8" (3.28m x 1.42m). Having window to rear elevation, a range of base and eye level units, stainless steel sink, plumbing for washing machine and ceramic tiled flooring.Shower Room having opaque glazed window to side elevation, a fully tiled shower cubicle with rain maker shower over, low level WC, wash hand basin and extractor fan. The property occupies a plot estimated to be in the region of two acres (subject to survey), this is separated into a substantial paddock enclosed by Lincolnshire post and rail fencing believed to extend to approximately an acre and a half. The remainder of the plot is laid to a substantial lawn area with a York stone paved patio. There is a substantial vegetable patch with green house and numerous beds well planted. There is a chicken run & further animal pens. To the rear of the property there is a gravel driveway offering ample off street parking & turning for several vehicles, leading to the garage being of brick and timber construction, open fronted offering ample parking for two vehicles and loft storage. listing.description: Key features:Strawberry cottageBuilt circa 1750A unique piece of history Double frontedDetachedFour bedroomsThree reception roomsTwo bathroomsGarageFront and rear gardensFull description:A wonderfully unique and incredibly distinguished double fronted family home.This property was built approximately 270 years ago during the reign of George II and its history is apparent in every brick.The property is detached and set back on manicured lawns, the plot on which it sits is spacious and the internal accommodation is symmetrical, well arranged and generously proportioned.The ground floor comprises a central staircase with two large reception rooms either side, there is a kitchen stretching the full width of the house and a drawing room to the rear, beyond this is a ground floor bathroom, access to the garage and a utility space.Upstairs is currently utilised as a holiday let, and provides hugely adaptable accommodation, there are four double rooms of equal size and a family bathroom.As well as the landscaped gardens to the front there is a spacious courtyard of fruit trees to the rear and a useable garage.This house is simply very special, its history and character are unparalleled locally and yet its adaptability and convenience is also ideal for modern living.Located just off the London Road, this home is moments from Isleworth mainline train station, a short walk from the village and close to the Duke of Northumberland's beautiful estate at Syon Park, as well as the historical riverside in Old IsleworthEPC Rating EBedroomBedroomBedroomBedroomBathroomBathroomReceptionReceptionReception

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2829 sq ft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.   The accommodation on the ground floor comprises of a spacious reception hall, sitting room with feature brick fireplace and sliding doors opening on to the garden, separate dining room, study, cloakroom and bedroom with ensuite shower room. The kitchen/breakfast room is a particular feature of the property. It is a generous size with a feature brick wall, sliding doors giving access to the side and sky light allowing for maximum light penetration. There are a good range of wall and base wooden fronted cabinets and granite works tops. Integrated appliances include a Stoves oven with 7 ring gas hob and extractor, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. A double garage can be accessed from the separate utility room that has plumbing for additional appliances. The upstairs accommodation is also of good proportions and include a master bedroom suite with fitted wardrobes and ensuite bathroom, three further bedrooms a family bathroom and galleried landing.SituationHuntsmans Close is a private and prestigious development off Homefield Road within easy reach of Warlingham Green with its range of local shops, restaurants and pubs and Sainsburys supermarket is a short distance away. The beautiful North Downs are close at hand providing the opportunity for pleasant walks. Nearby Upper Warlingham railway station (in zone 6) provides services to London Bridge and Victoria in approximately 35 minutes. The M25 motorway is about 4 miles away at junction 6. There are schools in both the state and private sectors, golf courses and riding schools nearby.OutsideTo the front of the property there is driveway providing off-street parking which leads to a double garage. The garage usefully has direct internal access to the house. The front garden is laid to lawn with flower beds and hedgerow. The rear garden enjoys a high degree of seclusion and is enclosed by evergreen trees, hedgerow and timber fencing. It is a wide level garden with a patio, lawn and mature flower borders.Entrance Hall Cloakroom Kitchen Dining Room Utility Room Sitting Room Dining Room Study Master Bedroom Bathroom Ensuite Shower Room Garage
listing.short_description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2788 sqft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.

listing.description: Situated in the prestigious and historical village of Hale in the L24 region, is this impressive four bedroom detached residence located on Church Road. Nestled among stunning gated private grounds, this inspiring family home has arrived at the sales market courtesy of award winning agents Move Residential. Electronically operated gates provide access to secluded landscaped gardens that surround this truly remarkable accommodation. Boasting generous proportions throughout, this thoughtfully designed and tastefully finished property promises to impress the most discerning purchaser. Upon entering the home you are greeted by a bright entrance hall which showcases beautiful exposed wooden beam work that reappears throughout the accommodation providing a wonderful contrast to the sensitively modernised interior. This warm welcome sets the standard for the rest of the property and provides access to two generously sized reception rooms. Each space is finished to an exacting standard and provides enviable living quarters for the family, with one room enjoying views and access to the picturesque rear gardens, and the other a traditional feature inglenook fireplace. At the heart of this home, is a spacious open plan dining room and kitchen offering an ideal spot for the family to gather at meal time. A plethora of high quality wall and base units are complemented by granite work surfaces, whilst a variety of integrated appliances are perfect for the avid cook! With attractive slate flooring, decorative radiator covers and an abundance of natural light flooding the area, this desirable space is the undoubted jewel in the crown. The appeal of this extraordinary residence is further enhanced by two sun rooms offering delightful alternative sitting areas for the family and guests to enjoy. The understated class of this family home continues to the first floor where four generously sized double bedrooms can be found. Awash with natural light and enjoying an elegant décor, each room enjoys spacious accommodation, with one boasting access to a private balcony, and another benefiting from private en suite facilities. Providing the finishing touches to this dream home is a four piece family bathroom suite. The exterior is equally remarkable and consists of beautifully manicured lawns and well established landscaping to all sides, and spectacular views of the river from the rear of the property. The residence also benefits from a detached garage and outbuildings housing a utility / laundry area.Entrance Hall -Double glazed UPVC frosted window to front aspect, stairs to first floor, radiator, original wooden front entrance door, exposed beamsReception Room One - listing.description: An attractive detached period house set in a superb position.As the attached floor plan explains the property is entered via an inviting entrance hallway which leads to the dual aspect kitchen breakfast room, utility room, wc, dual aspect and generously proportioned sitting room. The sitting room leads to a conservatory overlooking the gardens and a separate dining room.The first floor provides four bedrooms, the generous master bedroom is dual aspect and provides an ensuite shower room. The family bathroom is accessed directly from the landing.SituationThe property is situated on the outskirts of the popular village of Slinfold. Slinfold is noted for its period cottages and houses and has a shop, school, church and inn. Both Horsham and Billingshurst are about 4 miles, Guildford 17 miles and Gatwick Airport 20 miles. Within easy reach of the property there are excellent schooling facilities including Farlington, Pennthorpe and Cranleigh. Sporting and recreational facilities in the area include golf at the nearby Slinfold Park Golf and Country Club, the West Sussex Golf Club (Pulborough), Wildwood (Alfold) and Rookwood (Horsham). There are mainline rail services from both Horsham (Victoria/ London Bridge) and from Guildford (Waterloo).OutsideThe property sits in a charming plot of about 1.4 acres. Set well back from Lyons Road the private driveway to the house passes a large area of lawn (potential small paddock) and leads to a generously proportioned double garage and store. A pathway leads over a stream and into the main gardens where the house can be found.A patio sits nearest the house with the main gardens set predominantly to lawn. A number of specimen trees and flowering shrub borders add further interest.
listing.short_description: An attractive period house set in a secluded position on the edge of this wonderful West Sussex Village. The property offers a plot of about 1.4 acres, bordering woodland and open land and with a pretty stream running through it. EPC:F

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.
listing.description: The apartment benefits from direct garden square views and is accessed through a beautiful red brick Victorian conversion. The apartment comprises semi open-plan reception room ideal for entertaining and dining whilst enjoying the stunning garden views offered via three large floor-to-ceiling French windows. The sleeping space consists of a spacious double bedroom with built-in storage. The mezzanine level, located above the reception room and kitchen is ideal for use as an extra sleeping space or as an extension to the reception area. The remaining inclusions are a second bedroom/snug area and walk-in wardrobe and a private balcony overlooking Nevern Square which is large enough for a table and a number of chairs.The square is built in a style known as "Domestic Revival", which is quite different from that of the nearby streets. This style had been pioneered in the 1870s by architects such as J.J. Stevenson and Norman Shaw, for example in Palace Gate and Queen's Gate. Various features are derived from English and Flemish houses of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries, hence the use of the term "Revival". The houses are built of exposed brick, rather than stucco, using contrasting yellow and red bricks.• First floor flat with balcony• Views over and access to the garden square• Mezzanine level with second bedroom, study and walk-in wardrobe• Ample storage space• Contemporary kitchen and bathroom• Share of FreeholdThe nearest Tube station is Earl's Court (Piccadilly and District lines), with the motorist benefiting from quick access to the A4/M4 for routes to central London, Heathrow Airport and the M25. West Brompton Station is situated nearby which is serviced by the District line, Southern and London Overground.
listing.short_description: An exceptional one-bedroom apartment with an extraordinary reception room which includes a mezzanine level. Overlooks Nevern Square and is close to Earl's Court Tube station, SW5.

listing.description: Raithby Manor is a magnificent residence built in a period style to provide all the luxuries of a modern property with the character and grand proportions of a fine county house. Set in a pretty village in the picturesque Lincolnshire Wolds, approached via impressive gates to a large gravelled driveway and with fabulous views overlooking its own grounds and gardens with wooded areas, a walled garden with tennis court, a stable block, Stores, Garage Block and a large 1 bedroom self contained Annexe.The elegant accommodation includes a stately entrance Hall with Minstrels Gallery above, Cloaks/WC, 33' Main Sitting Room, 2 further Reception Rooms, Dining Room, a split level Family Dining Kitchen, Boot Room and WC, Utility Room and a 21' Games Room with full size snooker table. The spacious Master Bedroom Suite has equally splendid views with Dressing Room and En-Suite. There are 3 further Bedrooms, another En-Suite and a family Bathroom. The property has pvc sashcord windows, oil and ground sourced central heating with both radiators and underfloor systems.Viewing is essential to appreciate the setting and beautifully fitted interiors. listing.description: A beautifully presented semi-detached family home in a fabulous tree lined crescent much respected locally as one of Whetstones most desired roads. There is good access to the transport network with Oakleigh Park overground and Totteridge and Whetstone underground stations both within easy reach. There is a good selection of shops, restaurants and eateries close by. The tastefully presented accommodation briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hall, dual aspect study, dining room with a wide bay to the front, a fabulous main reception room with views over the rear garden. The kitchen/breakfast room is a lovely family hub with extensive units, integrated appliances and space for a breakfast table. There is a generous size full laundry/utility room and a separate guest toilet. To the first floor are four bedrooms, with the master having views over the rear garden whilst also benefitting from an en suite bathroom. There is a further bathroom and a separate WC. The accommodation could be further extended by converting the attic space subject to planning permission. Externally the property has driveway parking to the front providing parking for several vehicles. The rear garden has a south/westerly aspect, well-manicured lawns with flower and shrub borders, pond and water feature.
listing.short_description: A beautifully presented semi-detached family home in a fabulous tree lined crescent much respected locally as one of Whetstones most desired roads. (contd...)

listing.description: This individual, period, thatched cottage is situated down this tree lined road on Honey Hill, on the border between Crowthorne and the market town of Wokingham. The property is positioned on a large wide plot with views looking out onto fields and open countryside. To the front there is an 'in and out' drive, plus a second driveway offering access to four different garages and outbuildings.Internally there is a sitting room, living/dining room, modern kitchen, utility room, shower room and four double bedrooms. The master bedroom has a refitted en-suite bathroom, whilst the fourth bedroom also has an en-suite as well as its own independent access, ideal for an older child or even a home office.Although in a rural setting, there is easy access to the surrounding towns and rail and road links, via Crowthorne and Wokingham station and 329M and M4 motorways.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: The HouseThe Farmhouse is timber framed with a tiled slate roof, with the original building thought to date back to the 15th Century with later additions. The main house offers a generous 3815 square feet of versatile living accommodation which has served our client?S family very well over the past 30 years.The large front porch area leads to the sitting room featuring a beautiful open fireplace with wood-burning stove and brick surround. To the left of the living room is a small library area which leads into another reception room, currently used as a dining room with office. The right of the living room leads to a useful boot-room with WC and separate laundry/airing room, which then leads through to the kitchen.The kitchen is a good size and is fitted around a central island and family table and chairs. There is a range of wooden wall and base units, an electric oven and hob, and space for a fridge freezer. Off the kitchen is a large rear porch leading out to the garden, a useful space for coats and shoes. Finally, through the left of the kitchen is a third reception room, currently used as a second reception room/drawing room.There are two staircases on the ground floor, the stairs to the left-hand side of the house lead to the master suite which has immediate access to a bath and shower room. The other staircase leads up to three further bedrooms which all share the use of a shower room. The second floor has two further rooms (currently set up as a living room and bedroom) with access to a bathroom.The HistoryThe Farmhouse is thought to have been home to Thomas Mills, an historic businessman known locally for his help to the poor and huge contributions towards the education of the town and surrounding area. Schools were opened in his name from 1751 through to the Thomas Mills High School of today.The GroundsThe house lies within 4.8 acres, which include a large area of lawn to the front of the house, a shingle in-and-out drive, woodland, two ponds, a three-bay cart-lodge, former pigsties (used for storage) and a number of paddocks which provide equestrian potential or income from letting.The ClinicThe clinic is a converted barn to the rear of the house which is currently set up as a physiotherapy and hydrotherapy rehabilitation centre, complete with a heated indoor pool, shower facilities, changing rooms, waiting area / reception and treatment room. Another part of the barn is used for storage and the first floor has been converted. This extremely versatile building is currently let at £6,000 per annum but has the potential for several other uses if required.The CottageThis charming renovated cottage is self-contained and whilst currently empty, it could be let out to provide an annual income of around £6,000 per annum, alternatively it would make an ideal annexe. The accommodation includes a living room, kitchen/dining room, bathroom and double bedroom, as-well-as a small conservatory. The cottage also has its own garden area which could be fenced off from the rest of the land, adding to its rental appeal.LocationThe property sits in a screened location in the heart of the peaceful village of Pettistree in Suffolk. The village has a thriving public house () and is only a short drive from Wickham Market which includes most necessary day-to-day amenities. The thriving and extremely popular market town of Woodbridge is just a few miles away.For commuters, Suffolk?S County town of Ipswich is accessible via the A12 and provides direct trains to London Liverpool Street with a journey time of just over an hour.Points to noteThe property is on mains drainage and electricity; the house has night storage heaters with an economy7 supply.The property may fall under ?Mixed use? Estate and thus the stamp duty is lower. The house is Grade two listed.Before booking a viewing of any Bloomfield Grey instruction, we suggest that buyers view its full online details including the street-view representation, the site map, the satellite view and the floor plan. If you have any questions, then please contact Bloomfield Grey.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property with Currell, please be aware that fees will apply during the process. Details of these fees are as follows:

Administration Fees (Non-optional)
We charge £240 (including VAT) to cover the cost of administration of the tenancy. For clarity, this is a charge per tenancy and not per applicant.

Referencing Fees (Non-optional)
We use an independent referencing agency (rmt - Reference-My-Tenant) to carry out reference checks on all tenants. The cost of these checks are £40 (including VAT) per individual joining the tenancy and £50 (including VAT) if a company is being referenced. For clarity, each individual named in the tenancy agreement will need to pay a referencing fee. For example, 3 tenants = 3 referencing fees.

Check-In Fees (Non optional in the event that the Landlord uses the services of an Independent Inventory Clerk)
We use an independent inventory company (normally Ready Report) to carry out a Check-In and Check-Out service on all properties (subject to the landlord confirming that they wish to use this service). The cost of a check-in and check-out are identical and can vary from £108 (including VAT) to £240 (including VAT) dependent on the size of property and the amount of furnishings in the property. Most normally, tenants pay for a check-in and landlords pay for the check-out. For clarity, check in fees are payable per tenancy, not per applicant.

Early Termination (Non-optional in the event of leaving earlier than the tenancy allows)

A fundamental responsibility as a tenant is to pay your rent, but we recognize there may be circumstances whereby you need to break out of your tenancy early. If your Landlord agrees that the property can be re advertised, in order to find a suitable replacement tenant to take over your liability, you still need to continue making your regular rent payments until a new tenant takes occupation. In addition you will need to cover the Landlords fees for the unexpired term of your tenancy. These fees are calculated on a pro rata basis. Should you be thinking of leaving earlier than your tenancy agreement permits, you should contact your local branch as soon as possible for a detailed breakdown of the costs involved.

Other Fees

Currell also works on behalf of institutional, rather than private, Landlords who may have their own administration procedures and fees. This can mean that the costs vary from those detailed above. Details of these fees are available upon request, but please be assured that if these landlords charge fees then you will not be liable to pay any fees to us.

listing.description: Berkeleys - Delightful detached character cottage - Completely refurbished in recent years - Level south-westerly plot - Desirable Branksome Park location - 3 Double bedrooms - Dressing room and en-suite to master - Family bathroom - Living room with study area - Kitchen/breakfast room - Handmade French kitchen - Double garage - Summerhouse and garden storeThe Property    Twelve Trees Cottage is a delightful character property which has undergone complete refurbishment in recent years by the current owners and occupies a level south-westerly facing plot in one of Branksome Park's most desirable locations. The original house, we believe, was built over 200 years ago and is a house of local interest. The cottage has been sympathetically modernised throughout using materials, where possible, from the original house and garden. It retains many character features including open fireplaces and combines traditional architecture with modern living. The accommodation extends to approximately 1790 .The Location    Dover Road is a leafy un-adopted road set in the heart of Branksome Park and enjoys easy level access to local shops at Westbourne which are approximately quarter of a mile away. The beach, for which the area is renowned, is within one mile and a similar distance away is Parkstone 18-hole championship golf course. Poole Harbour is approximately 2 miles away with its numerous yacht clubs and marinas.The Accommodation    3 Double bedrooms - Dressing room to master - En-suite bathroom with Juliet balcony - Two further bedrooms - Family bathroom - Good sized living room with study area and locally handmade and designed open fireplace - Stunning kitchen/breakfast room with dining and seating area and open fireplace - Handmade French kitchen imported from France and fitted by French craftsmen with limestone flooring and Moroccan marble worktops - Southerly facing garden - Double garage with power and light - Summerhouse and garden store both with power and light - Driveway with off-road parking for several cars - 0.24 acre plot - Maintenance charges are approximately £200 per annum payable to the Dover Road Preservation Society who are responsible for the upkeep of the road and lighting - Council tax band G

Letting Fees And Charges
At johns&co we believe it is important that our prospective tenants are fully briefed on any costs that may be chargeable during their tenancy. Below is a summary of likely charges that may be incurred at the commencement, during and at the end of a tenancy.

All fees stated are inclusive of VAT (currently calculated at 20%)

Pre Tenancy
Reservation Fee: GBP500.00 (to secure the property for you for the tenancy, this fee is offset against the initial monies in advance)
Tenancy Agreement Preparation Administration Fee: GBP180.00
Reference Administration Fee: GBP35.00 per applicant
Deposit: Typically the equivalent of six weeks rent less the reservation fee

During The Tenancy
Renewal Tenancy Administration: GBP60.00
Change of Occupier: GBP100.00
Arrears Processing: The tenant must pay the reasonable costs of the Landlord’s Agent for each letter the Agent, acting reasonably, has to send to the tenant concerning breaches of the tenancy agreement.

End Of The Tenancy
Check out Report: GBP125.00 – GBP200.00 depending on size and location of the property.
(Please note that the Check Out Report is undertaken by an independent third party. We advise that this is further clarified with the office prior to the end of tenancy).

listing.description: Lovering House is an exceptional detached family property, set in large grounds of approximately 2/3 acre with private gated access. Having recently undergone a significant and comprehensive refurbishment this superb property now provides contemporary, luxurious accommodation set over four floors. The whole of the ground and lower ground floors are in Spanish Porcelain plank tiles with zoned, thermostatically controlled underfloor heating, whilst the first and second levels have golden oak flooring throughout. Rising from the spacious entrance hall is a bespoke golden oak staircase with led lighting and a steel and glass balustrade which connects the floors and leads to the spacious bedrooms and beautifully appointed bathrooms found on the upper floors.The main living area is an expansive open plan space combining Kitchen, Dining Room and Lounge with double bi-fold doors opening on to the pale grey Millboard decked area which stretches across the rear of the property. The kitchen is beautifully appointed, combining effortless style with cutting edge design. The Neff appliances are integrated and provide four ovens, including a steam oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher and Bean to Cup coffee machine. The central island unit has a highly polished Silestone work surface with a range of storage units incorporating the latest German Blu Motion soft close system, flush ceramic hob featuring quick-light cooking zones and pre-defined cooking areas and under-mount stainless steel sink with recessed drainage. Pop-up sockets with usb connection and remote control colour changing LED lighting are additional features, as is the recessed Luxair Italian extractor hood, also remote controlled.With independent access to and from both the front and rear of the property, the substantial utility has a vast array of storage options including additional fridge/freezer space and washing and drying appliances. There is integrated access to the garage, a cloakroom with WC and hand basin, and separate boiler room. In addition on the ground floor is a fully tiled wet room with black mirror stainless steel shower panel, body jets and hand set. Staircase access leads to the lower ground floor where you will find a fitted cinema room/snug with storage and also a rather useful wine/drinks store complete with refrigeration and work surfaces.The first and second floors are light and spacious, centred off the main stair-well and open, first floor landing. On this floor are five double bedrooms and two bathrooms, with an en-suite shower room and separate dressing room off bedroom one. A self-contained bedroom suite is situated on the second floor with a pretty master bedroom, golden oak and mirrored dressing room and stunning bathroom with separate shower, connected by the galleried landing. Natural light pours in from the perfectly situated sun tubes and excellent eaves storage is provided on both floors.Each bathroom is beautifully appointed, with LED backlit mirrors and white porcelain suites. The baths are freestanding and of contemporary design whilst the showers have Hudson Reed Shimmer Thermostatic Shower panels and chrome body jets. Each upstairs bathroom has an integrated wall mounted television screen with full audio, and each room in the house has integrated multimedia points.Outside the property is completely enclosed and private with access to the grey block paved driveway through bespoke powder coated steel gates, operated by double remote control and mobile phone technology. The gardens are mainly laid to lawn with pretty shrubs and borders and a variety of very well established trees. There is substantial parking for several vehicles however the electronic multi fold garage doors give access to a triple garage with underfloor heating, unglazed porcelain floor tiles with an anti-slip surface and plenty of secure storage. The outside of the building is half clad with Western Red Cedar and has grey, A energy rated PVCu glazing  short, this property is stunning. It provides flexible, spacious accommodation with the potential of five or six double bedrooms and matching living areas. There are few properties currently on the market offering the space, finish and location to match this house and we would advise viewing to avoid disappointment.Entrance Hallway - 9' 2'' x 15' 9'' (2.8m x 4.8m)Kitchen/Dining Room - 29' 3'' x 11' 10'' (8.912m x 3.609m)Sitting Room (l-Shaped) - 27' 6'' x 11' 11'' (8.386m x 3.638m)Cinema Room - 14' 6'' x 11' 6'' (4.418m x 3.502m)Bar/Wine Store - 6' 4'' x 6' 0'' (1.927m x 1.827m)Ground Floor Shower Room - 9' 10'' x 11' 10'' (3m x 3.6m)Utility Room - 15' 7'' x 9' 1'' (4.749m x 2.776m)Boiler RoomCloak RoomBedroom 1 - 18' 0'' x 12' 0'' (5.477m x 3.645m)Dressing Room - 5' 2'' x 9' 6'' (1.580m x 2.905m)Bedroom 2 - 16' 10'' x 11' 10'' (5.140m x 3.608m)Bedroom 3 - 12' 10'' x 11' 10'' (3.909m x 3.619m)Bedroom 4 - 11' 11'' x 11' 7'' (3.627m x 3.526m)En Suite Shower Room - 9' 5'' x 6' 3'' (2.880m x 1.902m)Bathroom - 13' 5'' x 9' 10'' (4.095m x 2.989m)Bedroon 5 - 17' 7'' x 16' 0'' (5.371m x 4.880m)Master Bedroom - 13' 5'' x 11' 6'' (4.080m x 3.508m)Dressing Room - 15' 11'' x 6' 3'' (4.863m x 1.898m)Bathroom - 12' 3'' x 11' 8'' (3.727m x 3.558m)

listing.description: A fabulous opportunity to purchase a stunning ground floor Victorian conversion flat in a highly sought after location between the Commons.This fantastic property spans the entire ground floor of an imposing Victorian building and offers over 1200sqft of internal space. There is an entrance hall with built in storage, and to the front there is a master bedroom with striking high ceilings, a large bay window allowing for lots of natural light and it also has a modern en-suite with a walk-in shower. There are two additional double bedrooms, both with room for storage and a further stylish bathroom with contemporary fittings. There is a wonderfully light reception room which has wooden flooring and whilst having a modern finish, the period charm remains by way of the fireplace and Victorian picture rails. The living room flows through to a simply stunning kitchen/breakfast room where the wooden floors and contemporary feel continues. The kitchen is fitted with integrated appliances and plenty of cupboards and work surface space, as well as having room for a large dining table. Bi-folding doors lead out to a secluded south facing garden, which has been well maintained by the current owners, with a paved area for entertaining as well as steps to a large lawn with mature borders. This property also benefits from having a share of the freehold and a large cellar, which is an excellent space for additional storage and also has the potential to convert, subject to the usual planning permission and consents.Located on a highly regarded road in between Clapham Common and Wandsworth Common this property is in an incredibly popular spot for easy access to Northcote Road with the array of shops, bars and restaurants offered here, as well as being centrally located between Wandsworth Common, Clapham Junction and Clapham South Stations offering excellent links into the city by way of mainline services as well as the Northern line. Honeywell Junior School is also close by.

listing.short_description:
Prestigious development opportunity with outline planning permission...
Presented to the market for the first time in over 70 years is 'The Manor', a quintessential Victorian Villa sat right back from the road within the historic village of Herne.
Occupying a substantial plot of approximately 1 acre, outline planning permission has been granted for the erection of 3 detached dwellings to the rear of the plot, offering an exclusive and prestigious development opportunity.
The proposed new properties will occupy good size plots and will provide garaging and off-road parking.
Dating back to the late 1800's, The Manor itself is in need of some updating and improvement, but presents an exciting opportunity to create a truly spectacular home.
A grand entrance hall leads to three large reception rooms, all palatial in size and featuring original wooden flooring, original fireplaces and other period features.
A kitchen/breakfast room, utility room and cloakroom also benefit the ground floor.
The stunning period staircase leads to a large galleried landing where six great size bedrooms are found, with the impressive master bedroom boasting a recently updated en-suite shower room.
A large family bathroom, separate WC and a laundry room completes the impressive first floor.
An integral garage and two long separate driveways provide extensive off-road parking.
Full details of the application can be found on the planning section of quoting the reference number: Ca//16/01607
This is an extremely rare opportunity and we highly advise an early viewing appointment to avoid disappointed. Viewings are strictly by appointment only with the exclusive sole agents, Kent Estate Agencies. Call to arrange your appointment today.

Location:
The historic village of Herne with the church of St. Martins dating circa 1558 is on the outskirts of the fast 'up-and-coming' seaside town of Herne Bay with its ever popular seafront and array of period architecture. The Cathedral City of Canterbury with its range of shopping facilities, restaurants and of course the Marlowe Theatre is only a short drive away and is well served by direct bus routes from the village of Herne. Canterbury is also well served by other amenities including a wealth of high-achieving schools. The harbour town of Whitstable is only 5 miles distant which enjoys a variety of shopping, educational and leisure amenities including sailing, water sports and bird watching, as well as the seafood restaurants for which it has become renowned. Excellent transport links are nearby with Herne Bay mainline train station providing direct links to London Victoria as well as the high speed Javelin service to St London St. Pancras. Easy access to the A299 is nearby providing road links to London via the M2.

listing.description: This prominently positioned, Grade II listed, six bedroom Georgian Town house overlooks the historic market place in the centre of Wallingford. Divided over four floors, accommodation is extensive with six bedrooms, two large reception rooms, a kitchen diner, three bathrooms a large cellar and numerous auxiliary spaces to include stores, a boiler room and utility space. To the rear of the property is a large private garden divided between lawn, beds a vegetable plot and patio, with parking off of Wood Street, accessed directly from the rear.Wallingford is a thriving Thameside Saxon town with extensive facilities and a number of shops including a Waitrose supermarket, a good selection of antique shops, boutiques and specialist stores with a traditional market being held every Friday in the town square. For a small town there is a wide range of places to eat from Italian, Chinese and Indian restaurants, to traditional public houses and a newly opened 'Gin Bar' called the Keep. The town also benefits from its own excellent cinema/theatre which is just a few metres away, and a sports park and leisure centre which offer the chance to join a number of well-established clubs such as cricket, rugby, football and hockey. There is an excellent choice of Golf Clubs nearby with Huntercombe and Goring & Streatley to name a couple. There are delightful riverside walks and a well established rowing club.There are excellent schools in the area, with Wallingford Secondary being a highly regarded state school. There is also a range of private options locally including Cranford House, Moulsford Preparatory and The Oratory, plus a wide choice of Oxford and Abingdon schools including Abingdon School, St Helen's and St Katharine's, The Manor Preparatory (all served by school buses that stop in Wallingford), The Dragon, Headington, Radley and the European School in nearby Culham.The property also owns the freehold of the shop currently occupied on a long lease by "Made (by raspberry tart)" and a pepper corn rent is paid as well as a contribution to the cost of the buildings insurance and roof repairs.NoticePlease note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.
listing.short_description: This prominently positioned, Grade II listed, six bedroom Georgian Town house overlooks the historic market place in the centre of Wallingford and is offered for sale with large gardens and parking.

listing.description: Nestled in the heart of Belsize Park, this well proportioned, bright and spacious apartment offers a fantastic opportunity for a small family or a couple looking to buy in one of the best locations in Belsize Park. Hillfield Court is situated just behind the shops and restaurants of Haverstock Hill in a quiet and leafy enclave, Approached through a private road, off Belsize Avenue, this red-brick period mansion block offers the privilege of a porter's service, coupled with communal gardens and a reserved off street parking space. The flat itself is situated on the fourth floor with access through a lift. A grand entrance hall leads to, two, generously proportioned bedrooms, a separate fitted kitchen, tiled bathroom and a feature, 26 ft, double aspect through reception room. Whilst this flat is in need of updating, it offers tremendous potential to make a lovely home.Whilst every effort is made to ensure the accuracy of the attached property details, it should be noted that the above measurements are approximate only. Floor plans are for representation purposes only. The layout of doors, windows and rooms are approximate and should be regarded as such by any prospective purchaser. listing.description: Beresford Residential are delighted to offer to the sales market this stunning Victorian home in a fantastic location.Beechdale Road is a quiet residential cul-de-sac, with no through traffic. It is immensely popular with young families and because if this has a strong community feel. Transport links are easily accessible, with the Victoria Line at Brixton being one of the few that enjoys a 24 hour weekend service. Furthermore the huge green space of Brockwell Park is just a few minutes’ walk away.This superb family home will give the new owners the fantastic opportunity to move straight in, but also to add further value through development should they wish. The ground floor of the property is home to two large reception rooms that in the current configuration have been knocked together into one large open and bright living area. The high ceilings further enhance the feeling of space and period correct cornicing and ceiling roses are still visible. The generously proportioned eat-in kitchen is at the rear of the property, and it boasts a huge amount of both under counter and wall mounted storage space, as well as an abundance of worktop that will please even the most serious of chefs. This entre area of the property is south facing and so it enjoys bright sunlight throughout the day.Ascending the stairs to the first floor you will find three large double bedrooms, all of which are finished in a neutral style. The master is an impressive size and flooded with natural light due to the two large windows. Also a family bathroom with separate WC is located on this floor. It is well presented throughout and the current owner has replaced the bathtub with large walk in shower. Continuing to the second floor you will find the fourth double bedroom, as well as a further kitchen that could be converted into a further fifth bedroom or home office/nursery with little effort.Completing this substantial property is the private rear garden that is south facing and currently finished with low maintenance in mind, furthermore the original external toilet is still intact and currently serves as a handy outside storeroom.Early viewing is recommended to secure this rare opportunity.
listing.short_description: Beresford Residential are delighted to offer to the sales market this stunning Victorian home in a fantastic location.

listing.description: SummaryAn imposing 17th & 18th century detached property recently reduced offering a fantastic opportunity to acquire this substantial family home with a wealth of character & original features, good sized garden and side driveway.DescriptionAn imposing 17th & 18th century detached property situated in the sought after Rutland village of North Luffenham, ideally located to the market towns of Oakham, Stamford & Uppingham. Luffenham Court started off as a 17th century cottage with Malthouse while an 18th century addition to the front of the property was added to create a spacious and imposing country house. Luffenham court has a wealth of character and original features throughout including fireplaces, exposed beams and stone work. The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall, five reception rooms, kitchen, utility room, cellar, 5 / 6 bedrooms with the master suite offering a dressing room & ensuite bathroom, shower room, family bathroom and attic rooms. The property also benefits from good sized gardens, parking for several cars and open fronted barn style garage.On the first floor there is a split landing giving access to the front & rear landings with space for seating on the inner landing. The front landing gives access to the second floor attic rooms, a large guest room (bedroom three), further bedroom at the front of the property & a four piece family bathroom. An impressive master bedroom to the front of the property with a large walk in dressing room & beautiful ensuite fitted with a traditional enamel bath, vanity wash hand basin with cupboards under, shower & separate wc. The rear landing in the older part of the property gives access to two further double bedrooms and a shower room which could easily be used as an ensuite to the furthest rear bedroom. The attic rooms have dorma windows at the front of the property with fantastic countryside views and could be converted into additional accommodation subject to building regulations & planning permission.Entrance HallDrawing Room 24' 3" x 15' 9"Dining Room 19' x 16' 1"Snug / Sitting Room 14' 9 x 14' 9"Kitchen 17' 1" x 12' 6"Dining / Breakfast Room 16' 1 x 8' 6"Utility Room 14' 5" x 7' 7"Store Room 14' 9" x 8' 2"Boot RoomGarden Room 16' 1 x 9' 10Old Malthouse 17' 9" x 16' 1"CellarFirst Floor LandingMaster Bedroom 18' 4" x 16' 1"Dressing Room 12' 6" x 8' 2"Ensuite Shower RoomBedroom Two 15' 5" x 10' 10"Bedroom Three 15'9 x 12' 2"Bedroom Four 13' 5 x 9' 10"Bedroom Five 12' 6 x 6' 7"Family BathroomOffice / Guest BedroomSecond Floor LandingAttic Rooms1.
